page.title: 03HOME LIFE IN STURTON 1
page.content: GENERALLY PEOPLE EAT AT HOME,PREPARING THEIR OWN FOOD. MANY GROW{VEGETABLES & {FRUIT}IN THEIR GARDENS. A FEW KEEP GOATS FOR{MILK}& CHICKENS FOR{EGGS. SOME REAR LAMBS,PIGS (SLAUGHTERED AT THE ABATTOIR) AND CHICKENS FOR{MEAT FOR THEIR OWN CONSUMPTION.SURPLUS PRODUCE IS MAINLY STORED IN{DEEP {FREEZERS;}A MINORITY CHOOSE TO PRESERVE BY{BOTTLING OR CURING.}OTHER HOUSEHOLDS PURCHASE THEIR ITEMS OF FOOD EITHER AT{LOCAL SHOPS}OR ON WEEKLY/MONTHLY VISITS TO{SUPERMARKETS &{FREEZER CENTRES}IN NEARBY TOWNS. {'PICK YOUR OWN'}PRODUCE FROM LOCAL FARMS IS POPULAR FOR ITS FRESHNESS & ECONOMY.{COOKING}IS DONE IN{ELECTRIC, {SOLID FUEL,CALOR GAS OR OIL COOKERS. {(MICROWAVE}OVENS ARE BECOMING POPULAR FOR THEIR SPEED). THESE FUELS ALSO PROVIDE{HEATING,}WITH ELECTRICITY PROVIDING{LIGHTING.
